sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is distributive over intersection.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2} and B = {3, 4}. Find the Cartesian product of A and B, and then find the intersection of the resulting set with the set C = {1, (2, 4)}. Finally, prove that the Cartesian product of A and C intersects the Cartesian product of B and C in exactly the same way as the Cartesian product of (A ∩ C) and (B ∩ C).
